title: Nordson (NDSN) Reports Q4: Everything You Need To Know Ahead Of Earnings
summary: Nordson (NDSN) is set to announce its Q4 earnings, with analysts expecting a 6.1% year-on-year revenue increase to $652.8 million and adjusted earnings of $2.37 per share. The company missed revenue expectations by 1.3% last quarter, but positive sentiment in the professional tools and equipment segment, where peers like Kennametal and Fortive reported strong Q4 results, may bode well for Nordson. The stock is up 12.1% over the last month, nearing its average analyst price target of $275.55.

title: Charlotte Wolf Tarfa is now VP-people & culture, India & southwest Asia, The Coca-Cola Company
summary: Charlotte Wolf Tarfa has been promoted to VP-People & Culture for India & Southwest Asia at The Coca-Cola Company. She joined the company in 2021 and previously served as VP-Global Talent Strategy and Succession. In her new role, Tarfa will oversee the people strategy, aligning talent, culture, and leadership development with the company's regional growth ambitions.

title: Forex Signals Feb 7: Palo Alto PANW, Coca-Cola, and Medtronic Earnings Preview
summary: This article previews upcoming earnings reports for Palo Alto Networks (PANW), Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP), and Medtronic (MDT), highlighting investor focus areas for each. It also discusses recent subdued market activity due to holidays and geopolitical tensions, alongside volatility in gold, Bitcoin, and Ethereum prices. Traders are advised to monitor forward guidance for these companies due to elevated valuations.

title: Fairlife, Coca-Cola Class Action Over Alleged Cow Abuse Trimmed
summary: A federal judge has narrowed a class action lawsuit against Coca-Cola Co. and its dairy unit fairlife LLC, which claimed the companies misled consumers about animal welfare. The judge preserved certain claims that argue the company's cartoon-cow logo and "fairlife" name imply ethical treatment of cows, despite alleged abuse at its facilities. These remaining claims involve breach of express warranty and a violation of California’s false-advertising law.

title: Fairlife, Coca-Cola Class Action Over Alleged Cow Abuse Trimmed
summary: A federal judge partially dismissed several claims in a class action lawsuit against Fairlife and Coca-Cola Co. The lawsuit alleged the companies misled consumers about animal welfare at their facilities, implying fair treatment through their brand name and logo. While some claims were trimmed, those based on the cartoon-cow logo and Fairlife name, including breach of express warranty and violation of California's false-advertising law, remain active.

title: Coca-Cola's Q4 Metrics Signal Growth or Slowing Momentum?
summary: Coca-Cola's Q4 2025 results showed growth in revenue and EPS, surpassing Zacks Consensus Estimates for EPS and North and Latin American revenues, driven by strategic pricing and diversification. Despite overall growth, some segments missed consensus estimates. The company anticipates continued revenue and earnings growth in 2026, supported by innovation and a focus on healthier options, while its stock performance lagged the industry but exhibits a higher forward P/E ratio.

title: Investors Appear Satisfied With Fomento Económico Mexicano, S.A.B. de C.V.'s (BMV:FEMSAUBD) Prospects
summary: Fomento Económico Mexicano, S.A.B. de C.V. (FEMSAUBD) has a high P/E ratio of 49.1x, significantly above the Mexican market average. Despite a recent decline in earnings, analysts forecast a 23% annual growth for the next three years, outpacing the market's 13% prediction. This optimistic growth outlook appears to be the primary reason investors are willing to pay a premium for the stock, believing Fomento Económico Mexicano. de's future performance will justify its current valuation.

title: Coca-Cola appoints Charlotte Wolf Tarfa as VP of People & Culture for India & Southwest Asia
summary: Coca-Cola has announced the appointment of Charlotte Wolf Tarfa as the new Vice President of People & Culture for its India and Southwest Asia operations. This move indicates a focus on strengthening human resources and cultural initiatives in the region.

title: Coca-Cola Europacific Partners $CCEP Shares Purchased by Public Sector Pension Investment Board
summary: Public Sector Pension Investment Board increased its stake in Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) by 10.0% in Q3, now holding 152,283 shares valued at $13.77 million. CCEP has a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with a target price of $100.80, and institutional investors own about 31.35% of the stock.

title: Inside Coca‑Cola’s 2026 growth playbook: Digital, innovation and change
summary: Coca-Cola is implementing a bold growth strategy for 2026 focused on digital transformation, innovation, and leadership changes. This includes appointing a new CEO, Henrique Braun, and a chief digital officer, Sedef Salingan Sahin, to drive digital prowess and efficiency. The company is also prioritizing "bigger and bolder innovation" in its product portfolio and localizing marketing strategies to recruit new consumers, while facing challenges like the future of Costa Coffee.

title: Cibc World Market Inc. Reduces Stock Holdings in Celsius Holdings Inc. $CELH
summary: Cibc World Market Inc. significantly reduced its stake in Celsius Holdings Inc. ($CELH) by 77.4% in Q3, selling over 207,000 shares. Despite this, institutional ownership of CELH remains at 60.95%, with other firms like Hood River Capital Management increasing their positions. The stock trades at $44.68, has a market cap of $11.52 billion, and holds a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average price target of $66.33.

title: Earnings To Watch: Pitney Bowes (PBI) Reports Q4 Results Tomorrow
summary: Pitney Bowes (NYSE:PBI) is set to announce its Q4 financial results on Tuesday after market hours. Analysts predict a 6.5% year-on-year revenue decline to $482.5 million and adjusted earnings of $0.38 per share, following a miss on revenue expectations last quarter. The company has underperformed Wall Street's revenue estimates in six of the last eight quarters, though its stock performance has been relatively better than peers recently.

title: Allegion (ALLE) Q4 Earnings: What To Expect
summary: Allegion (ALLE) is scheduled to report its Q4 earnings before market open this Tuesday. Analysts anticipate year-on-year revenue growth of 9.5% to $1.04 billion and adjusted earnings of $1.98 per share. The company has a mixed record on meeting revenue estimates in the past, but the electrical systems segment has shown positive investor sentiment recently.

title: JELD-WEN (JELD) Reports Q4: Everything You Need To Know Ahead Of Earnings
summary: JELD-WEN (JELD) is set to announce its Q4 earnings, with analysts expecting a 16.8% year-on-year revenue decline to $745.2 million and an adjusted loss of -$0.29 per share. The company missed revenue expectations in the previous quarter and five times over the last two years. While the home construction materials segment has seen positive investor sentiment, JELD-WEN's shares are down 23.8% over the last month, contrasting with peers like Simpson and Griffon who beat expectations.

title: Coca-Cola Israel fined 17.7 million shekels by Competition Authority
summary: The Israel Competition Authority has fined The Central Bottling Company, which operates Coca-Cola Israel and Tara Dairy, 17.7 million shekels for multiple violations of the Food Law. These violations include interfering with product display and pricing at retailers, and making prohibited payments. Despite the significant fine, which was substantially reduced from a potential maximum, no enforcement measures will be taken against senior company executives.

title: PepsiCo stock slips into Presidents Day break as buyback plan meets rate jitters
summary: PepsiCo stock (PEP) slipped 0.8% on Friday to $165.94 ahead of the Presidents Day holiday, as the company's new $10 billion buyback plan and dividend increase were met with investor caution regarding future interest rate cuts. The company is focusing on "value" offerings and price adjustments on snacks to address consumer affordability concerns, which could impact profit margins if volumes don't increase significantly. Investors are also anticipating the Federal Reserve's meeting minutes for further guidance on rate expectations.

title: Coca-Cola’s Week in Review: Analysts Raise Price Targets Q4 Beat
summary: Coca-Cola gained 12.5% year-to-date, outperforming the S&P 500, driven by a Q4 earnings beat and analyst upgrades, with UBS raising its price target to $87. Incoming CEO Henrique Braun plans aggressive innovation and portfolio adjustments, such as discontinuing the Minute Maid frozen lineup and expanding sports drink partnerships, to drive future growth and maintain premium valuations. Despite a slight revenue miss, strong organic revenue growth and Zero Sugar momentum indicate solid core business fundamentals as the company transitions to new leadership.

title: Illinois Municipal Retirement Fund Purchases 7,540 Shares of Coca-Cola Consolidated, Inc. $COKE
summary: The Illinois Municipal Retirement Fund increased its stake in Coca-Cola Consolidated, Inc. (NASDAQ:COKE) by 21.4% in the third quarter, acquiring an additional 7,540 shares to reach a total of 42,730 shares valued at approximately $5.006 million. This move is part of a broader trend of institutional investors boosting their positions in the company, bringing overall institutional ownership to 48.24%. Coca-Cola Consolidated recently paid a quarterly dividend of $0.25 and currently holds a "Buy" consensus rating from analysts.

title: Rezolve AI Buys Reward Loyalty UK for $230M, Targets $350M+ 2026 Revenue and $500M ARR
summary: Rezolve AI acquired Reward Loyalty UK for $230 million in an all-cash deal, aiming to significantly boost its revenue and ARR. The acquisition is expected to accelerate RezolvePay and strengthen its Brain Commerce platform by integrating Reward's transaction intelligence and banking partnerships. Rezolve projects over $350 million in revenue for 2026 and an exit ARR of at least $500 million, leveraging Reward's existing profitability and extensive retail and banking network.

title: Walmart To Lead Group Of 11 Companies Announcing Annual Dividend Increases In Second Half Of February
summary: Walmart Inc. is anticipated to declare its 53rd consecutive yearly dividend increase in late February, with projections ranging from 6.4% to 9.6%. While Walmart experienced accelerated dividend growth in recent years, a slowdown in EPS growth to approximately 4% for FY26 suggests a moderation to high single-digit dividend increases. Other companies expected to announce similar dividend hikes include Eaton and Steel Dynamics with notable double-digit increases, and Dividend Kings Genuine Parts and Coca-Cola continuing their multi-decade growth streaks.

title: Coca-Cola stock price drifts into Presidents Day break as KO investors eye CAGNY update
summary: Coca-Cola's stock (KO) closed slightly down at $78.68 before the Presidents Day long weekend, with investors anticipating an update from incoming CEO Henrique Braun and CFO John Murphy at the CAGNY conference on February 17. The update is expected to provide further details on Coca-Cola's 2026 volumes and pricing, especially after a recent earnings release and an analyst price target increase from Barclays. The company's 2026 outlook projects 4-5% organic revenue growth and 7-8% comparable EPS growth, though potential IRS litigation and the sale of Coca-Cola Beverages Africa present wild cards.

title: DBS Remains a Buy on Anheuser Busch InBev SA/NV (0RJI)
summary: DBS maintained a Buy rating on Anheuser Busch InBev SA/NV with a price target of €79.00, citing analyst Zheng Feng Chee's coverage in the Consumer Defensive sector. This rating follows a mixed sentiment from other analysts, with Citi also issuing a Buy, while ING Group downgraded the stock to a Hold. Anheuser Busch InBev SA/NV reported strong quarterly results, with revenue of €30.71 billion and a net profit of €4.1 billion for the quarter ending June 30.

title: Coca-Cola stock slips into long weekend; KO investors eye Tuesday CAGNY update
summary: Coca-Cola (KO) stock slipped 0.4% to $78.68 on Friday as investors await a crucial management update at the Consumer Analyst Group of New York (CAGNY) conference on February 17. The company's recent Q4 earnings showed a 2% net revenue increase and a 5% organic revenue rise, with future targets of 4-5% organic revenue growth and 7-8% comparable EPS growth by 2026. Investors are keen to hear how Coca-Cola plans to achieve stronger volume growth and adapt to changing consumer demands for low-sugar products, especially in light of the evolving calorie conversation influenced by weight-loss drugs.

title: Proctor (PG)'s a Machine Despite Slow Growth, Says Jim Cramer
summary: Jim Cramer describes Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) as a "machine" despite its slow organic growth. The company's shares are down 6% over the past year but up 13% year-to-date. Analysts have issued mixed ratings, with some noting sluggish organic sales growth but potential for fundamental improvement.

title: Coca-Cola sparks buzz after launching game-changing initiative: 'Requires collective effort'
summary: Coca-Cola Pakistan has launched a new initiative to combat plastic pollution by partnering with local environmental agencies to segregate recyclable materials in 10 model schools. This effort aims to increase recycling and educate students, contributing to a cleaner Punjab. While Coca-Cola has faced criticism for its overall plastic waste production, this program, along with other eco-friendly projects, highlights the importance of supporting such initiatives from major brands to encourage further environmental responsibility.

title: Coca-Cola's Performance Through its CEO Transition
summary: Coca-Cola reported modest revenue growth in 2025, with net revenues up 2% to US$11.8bn and comparable EPS climbing 6% to US$0.58 in the fourth quarter. The company faced challenges like a non-cash impairment charge and currency impacts but saw strong growth in Coca-Cola Zero and considerable cash generation. As James Quincey steps down, Henrique Braun will take over as CEO on March 31, 2026, with the company projecting continued organic revenue and EPS growth for the year.

title: Yao Ming won lawsuits against compais over profiting off his name and image
summary: Former NBA star Yao Ming has successfully sued companies for unauthorized use of his name and image. He won a significant lawsuit against Chinese sportswear company Wuhan Yunhe Dashayu Sportswear Co., Ltd. for using "Yao Ming Era," his signature, and portrait without permission, securing a 1 million yuan settlement. Previously, he also took action against Coca-Cola China in 2003 for similar infringements, where they issued an apology and ceased production.

title: DDD Partners LLC Invests $19.18 Million in PepsiCo, Inc. $PEP
summary: DDD Partners LLC has invested $19.18 million in PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ:PEP), acquiring 136,557 shares, which now represents 1.2% of its holdings. Several other institutional investors have also adjusted their positions in PepsiCo. The company recently announced strong financial results, a quarterly dividend of $1.4225 per share, and a $10 billion share buyback plan.

title: Assetmark Inc. Boosts Stock Position in Monster Beverage Corporation $MNST
summary: Assetmark Inc. significantly increased its stake in Monster Beverage Corporation (MNST) by 5.9% in Q3, now holding over 433,000 shares valued at approximately $29.18 million. Despite recent insider sales by Emelie Tirre and director Rodney C. Sacks in December, institutional investors and hedge funds maintain substantial ownership at 72.36%. Analysts have a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating for MNST with an average price target of $78.90, as the stock trades near its 1-year high.

title: Coca Cola Femsa (NYSE:KOF) Stock Rating Upgraded by Wall Street Zen
summary: Wall Street Zen has upgraded Coca Cola Femsa (NYSE:KOF) from a "hold" to a "buy" rating. This upgrade contributes to a consensus of five Buy and three Hold recommendations, with an average price target of $111.20. The stock opened at $112.84, reflecting a modest decrease of 1.2%, amidst recent adjustments in ratings by several other research firms.

title: PEP Stock Price, Forecast & Analysis | PEPSICO INC (NASDAQ:PEP)
summary: This article provides a comprehensive analysis of PepsiCo Inc. (NASDAQ: PEP) stock, including its current price, key statistics, technical and fundamental ratings from ChartMill, and analysts' forecasts. As of February 13, 2026, PEP's stock price is $165.94, with a 3.4% dividend yield, and analysts project a slight price decrease but anticipate EPS and revenue growth in the next year. The company operates in the Consumer Staples sector under the Soft Drinks & Non-alcoholic Beverages industry.

title: Coca-Cola FEMSA Prices MX$10 Billion Bond Deal
summary: Coca-Cola FEMSA has successfully raised MX$10 billion (US$582 million) through a local debt issuance, oversubscribing its initial target by 3.84 times. The proceeds will fund general corporate purposes and refinance existing debt. The company also announced strong sustainability performance, achieving its highest score in the FTSE Russell ESG evaluation and maintaining a "B" rating from CDP, alongside receiving Top Employers™ 2026 certification for its Mexico operations.

title: Coca-Cola trims product with new packaging change – but denies ‘shrinkflation’
summary: Coca-Cola is introducing its 7.5-ounce mini cans as single-serve options in convenience stores, a move a retail expert says is not "shrinkflation" but rather a smart business strategy. This offers consumers smaller portions and lower price points, catering to those seeking portion control or more affordable options. Coca-Cola aims to meet changing consumer habits and provide more choices across different occasions.

title: Review: Coca‑Cola Cherry Float — The Fruity Cream Rises To The Top
summary: This article reviews Coca-Cola's new Cherry Float and its Zero Sugar counterpart, comparing them to previous cream-flavored releases and Pepsi's similar product. The author finds the full-sugar Cherry Float to be a delightful, well-balanced beverage, praising its taste and versatility. However, the Zero Sugar version is heavily criticized for its lack of flavor and poor comparison to the original.

title: Coca-Cola FEMSA Raises Ps. 10 Billion in Oversubscribed Mexican Bond Offering
summary: Coca-Cola FEMSA successfully issued Ps. 10 billion in a dual-tranche bond offering in the Mexican market, consisting of a 10-year fixed-rate tranche and a three-year floating-rate tranche. The offering was significantly oversubscribed, drawing strong demand and reinforcing the company's financial flexibility. These funds will be used for general corporate needs, including refinancing upcoming debt maturities.

title: Cibc World Market Inc. Has $13.59 Million Stock Position in Monster Beverage Corporation $MNST
summary: Cibc World Market Inc. significantly increased its stake in Monster Beverage Corporation (NASDAQ:MNST) by 293.5% in Q3, now holding 201,872 shares valued at approximately $13.59 million. This move is part of a broader trend of institutional investors boosting their positions in MNST, with major firms like Norges Bank and Schroder Investment Management Group adding substantial holdings. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus for Monster Beverage, with an average target price of $78.90, despite some recent insider selling activity.

title: Monster Beverage Corporation (NASDAQ:MNST) Given Average Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" by Brokerages
summary: MarketBeat.com reports that analysts have given Monster Beverage Corporation (NASDAQ:MNST) an average recommendation of "Moderate Buy" based on ratings from 24 brokerages, with an average one-year price target of $78.90. Insider sales by Emelie Tirre and Rodney C. Sacks occurred in December, reducing insider ownership to 8.30%. The stock is trading near its 52-week high with a market cap of $79.3 billion and institutional ownership at 72.36%.

title: Coca-Cola trumpets its performance in China
summary: The Coca-Cola Company reported solid financial results for the fourth quarter and full-year 2025, with China highlighted as a crucial market for long-term growth. The company emphasizes its strategy in China to build for the long-term, investing ahead of the curve and focusing on local insights and consumer engagement during key cultural moments like the Spring Festival. Globally, Coca-Cola saw increased net operating revenues and net income, while its unit case volume remained flat year-over-year.

title: NASCAR® and Coca-Cola North America Extend Longstanding Partnership; BODYARMOR Named Official Sports Drink of NASCAR
summary: NASCAR and Coca-Cola North America have extended their long-standing Premier Partnership, with BODYARMOR Sports Drink now named the Official Sports Drink of NASCAR. This multi-year agreement expands Coca-Cola's involvement in the sport, integrating BODYARMOR into NASCAR's hydration category while maintaining Coca-Cola's designation as the Official Soft Drink. The partnership will feature robust activation platforms, including at-track experiences and expanded storytelling, and continue community impact initiatives.

title: BP p.l.c. (BP) Receives a Buy from DZ BANK AG
summary: DZ BANK AG analyst Werner Eisenmann maintained a Buy rating on BP p.l.c. shares, which closed at p448.35. Barclays' Lydia Rainforth also issued a Buy rating, while UBS maintained a Hold rating. BP p.l.c. recently reported a quarterly revenue of p48.39 billion and a net profit of p1.16 billion.

title: PepsiCo Up 18% in a Month: Smart Entry Point or Wait for a Pullback?
summary: PepsiCo (PEP) has seen an 18.2% stock increase over the past month, outperforming its industry and the S&P 500, fueled by strong Q4 2025 results and strategic execution. The company is trading near its 52-week high, above key moving averages, and analysts have recently increased EPS estimates. With a P/E multiple below the industry average, PepsiCo presents a balanced risk-reward profile for investors seeking steady growth and consistent returns.

title: Coca-Cola makes a surprising change to its products
summary: Coca-Cola is introducing smaller 7.5-oz mini cans as a single-serve option in convenience stores, available in various flavors. This move is presented as a way to offer consumers more affordable choices and portion control, rather than shrinkflation. The company noted its resilience in the market and its expanded beverage portfolio.

title: PepsiCo Up 18% in a Month: Smart Entry Point or Wait for a Pullback?
summary: PepsiCo's stock has surged 18.2% in the past month, outperforming its industry and the S&P 500, following strong fourth-quarter 2025 results driven by robust revenue growth and strategic execution. The company is trading above its moving averages and appears reasonably valued compared to the broader market, with a positive outlook for 2026 supported by broad portfolio refresh efforts and expected organic revenue and EPS growth. Analysts also show increasing confidence, with upward revisions to earnings estimates for 2026 and 2027.

title: Coca-Cola HBC Discloses Share Sale by New Business Director
summary: Coca-Cola HBC's New Business Director, Jaak Mikkel, sold 30,000 vested ordinary shares for approximately GBP 1.37 million on February 11, 2026. This transaction, stemming from a performance share award, was disclosed in compliance with UK and EU market abuse regulations to ensure transparency. Despite the insider sale, analysts and TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, maintain a positive outlook on GB:CCH stock, citing strong financial performance and strategic market positioning.

title: Restaurant Brands's (NYSE:QSR) Q4 CY2025: Beats On Revenue
summary: Restaurant Brands (NYSE:QSR) reported Q4 CY2025 revenue of $2.47 billion, exceeding analyst estimates by 2.1%, with a 7.4% year-on-year increase. The company also beat adjusted EPS estimates and showed strong growth in new locations and same-store sales. Despite positive results, the stock traded down immediately after the report, suggesting the market anticipated even stronger performance.

title: TD Cowen Maintains Buy on KO The Coca-Cola Company Feb 11 2026
summary: TD Cowen has reaffirmed its "Buy" rating for The Coca-Cola Company (KO) and increased its price target to $85, signaling continued confidence in the company's financial outlook and brand strength. This action reflects the firm's belief in Coca-Cola's revenue mix and margin outlook, despite a modest market response of a 1.37% intraday gain. Meyka AI also rates KO with a B+ grade, suggesting a positive outlook based on various financial metrics and market comparisons.

title: How Did Coca-Cola CEO James Quincey Deliver In Last Year?
summary: Coca-Cola closed 2025 with modest revenue growth and steady volume trends, despite some one-time charges and currency headwinds, marking James Quincey's final results as CEO before stepping down. Henrique Braun is set to succeed him on March 31, inheriting a company focused on continued expansion and anticipating 4-5% organic revenue growth in 2026. The company successfully executed its strategy in a complex environment, achieving initial guidance and maintaining strong cash flow generation, including 63 consecutive years of dividend increases.

title: PG&E shares fall 2% as Q4 earnings miss overshadows 2026 guidance By Investing.com
summary: PG&E Corporation's shares fell 2.11% in pre-market trading after the company reported fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $0.36 per share, missing analyst estimates of $0.37. Despite the earnings miss, PG&E tightened its 2026 non-GAAP core earnings guidance to $1.64-$1.66 per share, which is above the analyst consensus of $1.60. The company also highlighted operational achievements including a reduction in operating costs and improved systemwide reliability.

title: Illinois Municipal Retirement Fund Grows Position in PepsiCo, Inc. $PEP
summary: The Illinois Municipal Retirement Fund increased its stake in PepsiCo (PEP) by 13.1% in Q3, now owning 198,655 shares valued at $27.9 million. This move comes as PepsiCo authorized a $10 billion share buyback and declared a quarterly dividend of $1.4225 per share, reflecting strong financial performance including beating EPS and revenue estimates. Despite mixed analyst ratings, major institutional investors continue to increase their holdings, with 73.1% of the company's stock now owned by institutions.

title: Caprock Group LLC Makes New Investment in PepsiCo, Inc. $PEP
summary: Caprock Group LLC has acquired a new stake in PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ:PEP) during the third quarter, purchasing 29,624 shares valued at approximately $4.404 million. Other institutional investors like Norges Bank, Laurel Wealth Advisors LLC, Charles Schwab Investment Management Inc., Franklin Resources Inc., and First Trust Advisors LP also significantly adjusted their holdings in PepsiCo, demonstrating substantial institutional interest in the company. PepsiCo reported strong quarterly earnings, beating analyst estimates, and announced a new stock buyback plan of $10 billion and a quarterly dividend of $1.4225 per share.
